get.summary: Get a list of agents
get.description: Requires all of the following permissions: admin.crossorg_computer.read

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: When specified, retrieves user's agents associated with this id.

parameters.name: agentType
parameters.description: When specified, retrieves agents associated with this agent type.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: When specified, retrieves agents associated with this activity status.

parameters.name: agentHealthy
parameters.description: Optionally retrieve agents with this health status. Agents that have no health issue types are considered healthy

parameters.name: anyOfAgentHealthIssueTypes
parameters.description: Optionally retrieve agents that have (at least) any of the given issue type(s). Multiple types are separated by a comma. Example health issue types: NOT_CONNECTING, NOT_SENDING_SECURITY_EVENTS

parameters.name: srtKey
parameters.description: Sort the list of agents by this criteria.

parameters.name: srtDir
parameters.description: Sort the list of agents in this direction.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of values to return.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of values per page.

200.description: The agent list was retrieved successfully.

400.description: Bad request.

post.summary: Activate a set of deactivated agents.
post.description: Requires all of the following permissions: admin.crossorg_computer.update

401.description: Insufficient permissions to perform the operation.

404.description: One or more agents not found.

post.summary: Deactivates a set of activated agents.
post.description: Requires all of the following permissions: admin.crossorg_computer.update

401.description: Insufficient permissions to perform the operation.

404.description: One or more agents not found.

get.summary: Get single agent by its identifier.
get.description: Requires all of the following permissions: admin.crossorg_computer.read

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the agent to return.

200.description: The single agent was retrieved successfully.

404.description: Agent was not found.

put.description: Requires all of the following permissions: admin.crossorg_computer.update

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the agent to update.

400.description: One or more of the fields has an invalid value.

401.description: Insufficient permissions to perform the operation.

404.description: Agent was not found.

get.summary: Get a User authentication token
get.description: Most APIs require a Bearer token to be submitted in order to determine the calling user's identity and permissions. Call this endpoint with your user's basic authentication credentials to retrieve its Bearer token. If your organization uses two-factor authentication for local users, you must also include a totp-auth header value containing the Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP).

parameters.name: totp-auth
parameters.description: Used for passing in the Time based One Time Password (TOTP), for use with Code42's TOTP authentication functionality. This is required for all users with TOTP two factor authentication enabled.

200.description: Request was successful and the bearer token is included in the response.

401.description: The supplied credentials in authHeader are invalid

get.summary: Get customer account information.
get.description: Some APIs require a tenant ID to be submitted to retrieve or edit Code42 data. Call this endpoint to retrieve the tenant ID to use for those APIs.

200.description: Request was successful. Returns customer account information

403.description: Authenticated principal is not authorized for this action.

404.description: A customer was not found

parameters.name: blocked

post.summary: Search for audit events
post.description:
General purpose audit-log search. All parameters are optional. A search with no arguments returns all events to which the searching user has access.

A search with multiple values for a single parameter applies "or" logic for that parameter. e.g. Searching for "actor_name=[alice@example.com, bob@example.com]" finds events for which either alice or bob was the actor.

A search with multiple parameters applies "and" logic between parameters. e.g. Searching for "event_type=user_registered,actor_name=alice@example.com" finds user_registered events for which alice@example.com was the actor.

post.summary: Get the number of events matching a search
post.description: Returns the count of events found in a search with identical parameters and at the same time. Parameters follow an identical behavior for this results count query, as they would the audit-log search query.

post.summary: Search for audit events, specifically for large result sets
post.description: Audit-log search, parameters follow an identical behavior for this results count query, as they would the general purpose audit-log search query.

AgentChannelUpgrade_ActivateChannel.description:
Activates an agent upgrade channel. A channel must be activated in order for any tenants and organizations using
it to receive agent upgrades.
Fails if the specified channel name is not found.

AgentChannelUpgrade_AddPrivateChannel.description: Allow a tenant to have access to a private channel. The tenant of the logged in user is used.

AgentChannelUpgrade_CreateChannel.description:
Creates an agent upgrade channel.
A newly created channel is not activated and supports DCU delays by default.
Fails if the supplied name is invalid or the name is already in use.

name.description:
The name of the channel to create.
_Required._

type.description:
The type of the channel.
_Values_: [LIVE, DCU].
_Required._

visibility.description:
Specifies if the channel is publicly visible or private.
_Values_: [PUBLIC, PRIVATE].
_Default Value_: PRIVATE

AgentChannelUpgrade_DeactivateChannel.description:
Deactivates an agent upgrade channel. Tenants and organizations using a deactivated channel will not receive
agent upgrades until the channel is activated.
Fails if the specified channel name is not found.

AgentChannelUpgrade_DeleteAvailability.description:
Deletes the availability date for the specified version in the specified channel. Note that successful execution
of this method on a "LIVE" channel will leave the channel empty.
Fails if the channel does not exist or the version does not have an availability date in the channel.

version.description:
The version for which to delete the availability date.
is not blank
has length between 3 and 24, inclusive
Device version and build
_Required._

name.description:
The name of the channel to delete.
_Required._

AgentChannelUpgrade_RemoveOrgChannel.description:
Removes the channel previously set for the organization. The organization will use the channel resolved
through its settings hierarchy.
Fails if the provided channel name does not match the name of the channel previously set for the organization.

AgentChannelUpgrade_RemovePrivateChannel.description: No longer allow a tenant to have access to a private channel. The tenant of the logged in user is used.

AgentChannelUpgrade_RemoveTenantChannel.description:
Removes the channel previously set for the tenant. The tenant will use the system's channel.
Fails if the provided channel name does not match the name of the channel previously set for the tenant.

AgentChannelUpgrade_SetAvailability.description:
Sets the availability date for the specified version in the specified channel. Overwrites any previously set date.
The availabilityDate is ignored if attempting to set availability on a "LIVE" channel.
Fails if the channel does not exist or if the date is outside of the acceptable range.

date.description:
The date when the version will be made available.
_Format_: date
_Required._

version.description:
The version for which to set the availability date.
is not blank
has length between 3 and 24, inclusive
Device version and build
_Required._

AgentChannelUpgrade_SetOrgChannel.description:
Sets the channel which the organization will use to determine its agent upgrades. This will override any channel
found through the organization's settings hierarchy.
Fails if the channel does not exist or if a channel is already set for the organization.

AgentChannelUpgrade_SetTenantChannel.description:
Sets the channel which the tenant will use to determine its agent upgrades.
Fails if the channel does not exist or if a channel is already set for the tenant.

GLOBAL: Excludes files from backup no matter where the files are being backed up, whether to local storage (for example, an external drive) or to Code42 cloud storage.
CLOUD: Exclude files from backup to Code42 cloud storage, but not from local storage (for example, external drives).
USER: Exclude file types from a backup for a user.
_Values_: [GLOBAL, CLOUD, USER].
_Required._

Role_Publish.description:
Publish all the roles and permission assignments for the directory. This command will always take in the full set
of directory roles. At the end of a successful command, the directory roles in the system will match what was provided.
This means adding or updating existing roles. Deleting a role will not be allowed until PL-95261. This command supports
being called before or after the permission definitions are published.

agentTimestamp.title: Date and time that the Code42 service on the device detected an event; based on the device's system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

eventAction.title: The type of file event observed. For example: file-modified, application-read, removable-media-created.

eventId.title: The unique identifier for the event.

fileName.title: The name of the file, including the file extension.

md5.title: The MD5 hash of the file contents.

sourceAccountName.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the name of the cloud account where the event was observed. This can help identify if the activity occurred in a business or personal account.

sourceAccountType.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the type of account where the event was observed. For example, 'BUSINESS' or 'PERSONAL'.

sourceCategory.title: General category of where the file originated. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

items.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in file.acquiredFrom.tabs.url.

sourceDomains.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in file.acquiredFrom.tabs.url.

sourceName.title: The name reported by the device's operating system.  This may be different than the device name in the Code42 console.

tabs.title: Metadata about the browser tab source.

userEmail.title: The Code42 username used to sign in to the Code42 app on the device (for endpoint events) or the cloud service username of the person who caused the event (for cloud events).

AcquiredFrom.title: List of other events associated with this file. This can help determine the origin of the file.

repositoryEmail.title: The email address specified by the user who performed the Git event. This is a user-defined value and may differ from the credentials used to sign in to Git.

repositoryUri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the Git repository.

repositoryUser.title: The username specified by the user who performed the Git event. This is a user-defined value and may differ from the credentials used to sign in to Git.

AcquiredFromGit.title: Metadata about the Git activity associated with this event.

items.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider.

email.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider.

accountName.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the name of the cloud account where the event was observed. This can help identify if the activity occurred in a business or personal account.

accountType.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the type of account where the event was observed. For example, 'BUSINESS' or 'PERSONAL'.

category.title: General category of where the file originated. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

items.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in destination.tabs.url.

domains.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in destination.tabs.url.

ip.title: The external IP address of the user's device.

name.title: The name reported by the device's operating system.  This may be different than the device name in the Code42 console.

operatingSystem.title: The operating system of the destination device.

printJobName.title: For print events, the name of the print job, as reported by the user's device.

printerName.title: For print events, the name of the printer the job was sent to.

items.title: The IP address of the user's device on your internal network, including Network interfaces, Virtual Network Interface controllers (NICs), and Loopback/non-routable addresses.

privateIp.title: The IP address of the user's device on your internal network, including Network interfaces, Virtual Network Interface controllers (NICs), and Loopback/non-routable addresses.

remoteHostname.title: For events where a file transfer tool was used, the destination hostname.

tabs.title: Metadata about the browser tab destination.

Destination.title: Metadata about the destination of the file event.

items.title: The email addresses of those who received the email. Includes the To, Cc, and Bcc recipients.

recipients.title: The email addresses of those who received the email. Includes the To, Cc, and Bcc recipients.

subject.title: The subject of the email message.

items.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider. For cloud events, the email addresses of users added as sharing recipients. In some case, OneDrive events may return multiple values, but this is often the same username formatted in different ways.

email.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider. For cloud events, the email addresses of users added as sharing recipients. In some case, OneDrive events may return multiple values, but this is often the same username formatted in different ways.

action.title: The type of file event observed. For example: file-modified, application-read, removable-media-created.

detectorDisplayName.title: Indicates the name you provided when the cloud data connection was initially configured in the Code42 console.

id.title: The unique identifier for the event.

ingested.title: Date and time the event was initially received by Code42; timestamp is based on the Code42 server system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

inserted.title: Date and time the event processing is completed by Code42; timestamp is based on the Code42 server system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically occurs very soon after the event.ingested time.

observer.title: The data source that captured the file event. For example: GoogleDrive, Office365, Salesforce.

items.title: Sharing types added by this event.

shareType.title: Sharing types added by this event.

ActivityAction.description: A list of activity actions associated with the action group.

type.description:
Below you will find specific activity actions supported for each trusted activity type.

|  Action / Type  | `ACCOUNT_NAME` | `DOMAIN` | `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI` | `SLACK` | `URL_PATH` |
|:---------------:|:--------------:|:--------:|:--------------------:|:-------:|------------|
| `CLOUD_SHARE`   |                |         |                      |         |            |
| `CLOUD_SYNC`    |               |         |                      |         |            |
| `EMAIL`         |                |         |                      |         |            |
| `FILE_TRANSFER` |                |         |                      |         |            |
| `FILE_UPLOAD`   |                |         |                      |         |            |
| `GIT_PUSH`      |                |         |                     |         |            |

Note: Trusted activity types `SLACK` and `URL_PATH` do not support any activity action defintion. 
For these trusted activity types, simply pass an empty array for activityActions.

activityActions.description: A list of activity actions associated with the action group.

name.description: The name of the activity action group.

ActivityActionProvider.description: An Activity Action Provider associated with an activity action.

name.description:
The only two Trusted Activity Types that support specific providers are `DOMAIN` and `ACCOUNT_NAME`.

Below you will find specific providers for each action supported by the `DOMAIN` and `ACCOUNT_NAME` types. 
If no providers are listed for a particular action, it means that no specific providers are required for that action type. 
Pass an empty array for providers. 

Providers for each action supported by the `DOMAIN` type:

| Provider / Action | `CLOUD_SHARE` | `CLOUD_SYNC` | `EMAIL` | `FILE_UPLOAD` | `GIT_PUSH` |
|:-----------------:|:-------------:|:------------:|:-------:|:-------------:|:----------:|

totalCount.description: The total count of TrustedActivityResponse objects returned.

activityActionGroups.description:
The collection of activity action groups the associated trusted activity applies to. 
Below you will find specific requirements for each trusted activity type.
- `DOMAIN` - If no activity action group is provided, the default will be assigned implicitly. Else; the supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration. 
- `ACCOUNT_NAME` - At least one activity action group is required. On update, The supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration.
- `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI` - At least one activity action group is required. On update, The supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration.
- `SLACK` - No activity action groups are allowed - array must be empty.
- `URL_PATH` - No activity action groups are allowed - array must be empty.

description.description: A description of the trusted activity.

isHighValueSource.description:
Indicates if the resource is a high value source of company information. If true, a source risk indicator is 
applied to events for files downloaded from this location and later uploaded to an untrusted destination.
### Supported trusted activity types

- `DOMAIN`
- `SLACK`
- `URL_PATH`
- `ACCOUNT_NAME`
- `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI`

Note: When updating a resource, if the `isHighValueSource` property is not explicitly set, the existing value
of the property remains unchanged.

name.description: The name of the alert.  Same as the name of the rule that triggered it.

description.description: The description of the alert.  Same as the description of the rule that triggered it.
description.example: Alert me on all removable media exfiltration.

actor.description: The user who triggered the alert.

actorId.description: The authority user id who triggered the alert, if it is available.

severity.description: Indicates static rule severity of the alert.

riskSeverity.description: Indicates event risk severity of the alert.

notificationInfo.description: Notification information of the alert.  Not queried/returned.

ruleId.description: The unique id corresponding to the rule which triggered the alert.

ruleSource.description: Indicates source of rule creation.  Either alerting or lens application name.

watchlists.description: Watchlists the actor is on at the time of the alert.

userEducation.description: User education will be populated if the alert is configured to send a response.

lessonId.description: Unique id of this response lesson.

isAutoDismissAlertEnabled.description: True if the alert is configured to auto-dismiss upon response.

badFilter.description: The filter that caused the issue.

type.description: The type of query problem.

ProblemType.description: Potential issues when running a query on alerts.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

groupClause.description: The clause to use when combining group filters.  Must be AND/OR.

pgSize.description: The number of items to return in one request.  Value must be between 0 and 100.

pgNum.description: The page number to return. Page 0 is the first page of results.

srtKey.description: The alert attribute to sort by.  Value must be one of: AlertId, TenantId, Type, Name, Description, Actor, ActorId, Target, RiskSeverity, RuleSource, CreatedAt, Observations, Notes, Watchlists, HasAuthSignificantWatchlist, State, StateLastModifiedAt, StateLastModifiedBy, LastModifiedTime, LastModifiedBy, RuleId, Education, Severity

SortDirection.description: The sort direction applied to the returned page of alerts.

alerts.description: The alerts returned by the details query.

observations.description: Observation list included on the alert.

note.description: Most recent note added to the alert.

observedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was first observed.

lastObservedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was last observed.

type.description: The type of observation data recorded.

data.description: The JSON formatted observation data rolled into one aggregation.

alertIds.description: The unique identifiers representing the alerts you want to act upon.

alert.description: The alerts returned by the details query.

note.description: Most recent note added to the alert.

riskSeveritySummary.description: Risk severity summary of the alert.

ffsUrlEndpoint.description: Link to the alert's endpoint events in forensic search.

ffsUrlCloud.description: Link to the alert's cloud sharing events in forensic search.

alertUrl.description: Link to the alert's details in the alerting application.

observedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was first observed.

lastObservedAt.description: Timestamp when the activity was last observed.

type.description: The type of observation data recorded.

data.description: The JSON formatted observation data rolled into one aggregation.

severity.description: Risk severity associated with the event

numEvents.description: Number of events with this severity level.

summarizedRiskIndicators.description: Each risk indicator that matched the events in this grouping

numEvents.description: The number of events with this risk indicator

alertId.description: The unique identifier representing the alert you want to act upon.

alert.description: The alerts returned by the details query.

firstObservationAt.description: Timestamp of the first observation or activity.

lastObservationAt.description: Timestamp of the last observation or activity.

fileCount.description: Total number of files in the observations.

totalFileSize.description: Sum of all file sizes in bytes.

note.description: Most recent note added to the alert.

riskSeveritySummary.description: Risk severity summary of the alert.

alertUrl.description: Link to the alert's details in the alerting application.

type.description: The type of action.

ObservedActionType.description: Enum indicating the type of action.

alertId.description: The unique identifier representing the alert you want to act upon.

ruleMetadata.description: List of rules that are returned.

totalCount.description: The number of rules that match the given query.

problems.description: Potential issues that were hit while trying to run the query.

createdBy.description: Username of the individual who created the rule.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the rule was created.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

observerRuleId.description: Id of the rule in the observer.

type.description: Rule type of the rule.

description.example: Will generate alerts when files moved to USB.

severity.description: The static severity of the rule (deprecated).

isSystem.description: Boolean indicating if the rule was created from another Code42 Application.

isEnabled.description: Boolean indicating if the rule is enabled to trigger alerts.

ruleSource.description: The source of the rule.  Will be one of [DepartingEmployee, Alerting, HighRiskEmployee]

ruleWarning.description: Enum flag indicating there is a warning associated with the given rule.

RuleWarning.description: Enum flag indicating there is a warning associated with the given rule.

modifiedBy.description: Username of the individual who last modified the rule.

modifiedAt.description: Timestamp of when the rule was last modified.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

groupClause.description: The clause to use when combining group filters.  Must be AND/OR.

pgSize.description: The number of items to return in one request.  Value must be between 0 and 100.

pgNum.description: The page number to return. Page 0 is the first page of results.

srtKey.description: The rule metadata attribute to sort by.  Value must be one of: RuleMetadataId, TenantId, ObserverRuleId, Type, Name, Description, IsEnabled, ModifiedAt, ModifiedBy, CreatedAt, CreatedBy, RuleWarning, LogString
